Package game

package game
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    Armour
    Represents an armour collectible in the game.
    ArmourCollision
    Handles collision events between a player and an armour collectible in the game.
    BulletCollision
    Manages collision events for bullets within the game.
    Bullets
    Represents bullet collectibles in the game world.
    Collectible
    Represents a generic collectible item within the game.
    CollectibleCollision
    Provides a base for handling collisions between a player and various collectibles in the game.
    CollectibleMovement
    Manages the vertical movement of a collectible within specified boundaries in the game world.
    Diamond
    Represents a diamond collectible that functions as a doorway in the game.
    DiamondCollision
    Handles collision events involving diamonds in the game.
    Door
    Represents a door in the game that can be interacted with by the player.
    Doorway
    Serves as an abstract base class for doorway-like structures in the game.
    DoorwayCollision
    Handles collision events with doorways to trigger level transitions in the game.
    Enemy
    Represents an enemy character in the game, specifically a zombie.
    EnemyCollision
    Handles collision events between a player and enemies in the game.
    EnemyFollowsPlayer
    Implements behavior for an enemy to follow a player within the game world.
    EnemyPatrolling
    Implements a patrolling behavior for an enemy within the game world.
    FlyingEnemy
    Represents a flying enemy in the game that actively follows the player.
    FlyingEnemyCollision
    Handles collision events between a player and flying enemies in the game.
    FlyingUpdater
    Implements periodic updates for a flying enemy's behavior within the game.
    Game
    The main game setup class that initializes and controls game flow, UI components, and sound.
    GameLevel
    An abstract base class representing a game level in the platform game.
    GameState
    Manages and tracks the state of the game, including game over, level won, and game won conditions.
    GameView
    Provides the visual rendering context for the game, handling the drawing of the game background, player status bars, and other game state information.
    Gun
    Represents a collectible gun in the game that players can pick up.
    GunCollision
    Manages collision events for the gun collectible in the game.
    HealthPotion
    Represents a health potion collectible that players can pick up to restore health.
    HealthPotionCollision
    Manages collision events for health potion collectibles in the game.
    HorizontalPlatformMovement
    Handles horizontal movement of a platform within specified boundaries.
    Key
    Represents a key in the game world that players can collect.
    KeyCollision
    Manages collision events for a key collectible in the game.
    KeyMovement
    Controls the vertical floating movement of a key within designated upper and lower boundaries.
    Level1
    Represents the first level of the game, containing specific game objects like platforms, enemies, and collectibles.
    Level2
    Represents the second level of the game, containing specialized setups for platforms, enemies, and collectibles.
    Level3
    Represents the third level of the game, designed with various interactive and dynamic elements.
    Player
    Represents a player in the game with various states and behaviors such as moving left and right, idle states, and attacking mechanisms.
    PlayerController
    Controls a Player object in response to user inputs from the keyboard and mouse.
    PolygonEditor
    Very basic polygon editor.
    Portal
    Represents a portal in a game world, which is a special type of doorway that emits sound when destroyed.
    VerticalPlatformMovement
    Handles the vertical movement of a static platform in a game.
